Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the existence of a college regulation that automatically awards a 4.0 grade point average to a student whose roommate commits suicide. No such policy exists in any college or university in the United States.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks any evidence or support to back up the existence of the mentioned college regulation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that a college regulation exists without providing any proof or supporting information.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no college or university in the United States has a policy awarding a 4.0 average to a student whose roommate dies.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert provides an alternative explanation for the origin of the claim, suggesting that it started as a morbid joke and later spread as a legend among students.
